item.title: Careful with randomness!

item.description:
Signature schemes

Let ùí¢ be a commutative group under the addition law (+) and let G ‚àä ùí¢. The group has an order p. We define a scalar multiplication k*G as G+...+G, k times. Now assume that given an element Q ‚àä ùí¢ it is computationally unfeasible to find k such that Q = k*G. We have seen in a different challenge that it is easy to go from G to k*G but now we are assuming that it is hard to go from k*G to G. This is called a one-way function. In this challenge, we will build a signature scheme based on this function.
